title: reckless mum who got sloshed on toffee flavoured vodka at glastonbury for kids drove children while three times over limit
story: Laura Roberts appeared at Stockport Magistrates Court yesterday where she pleaded guilty to drink driving after she crashed with the children in the car.The mum, 36, from Wigan, had attended the Geronimo Festival at Arley Hall in Cheshire with her children, aged two and four, as a treat for them after she and their father had split up, the court heard.During the last night of the festival on May 27, she drank toffee-flavoured vodka.The next morning she had a glass of wine and, believing she was exhausted as a result of sunburn rather than drunk, put her kids into her car and drove home.However a witness saw Roberts swerving in the road and overtook the mum before pulling in front of the car. Roberts drove into the back of the car, but no one was injured.Roberts was made to do a breathalyser test, which came back with two different readings.The mum was then tested for alcohol in her blood and the result came back to reveal that she was more than three times the legal limit.Prosecuting, Steve Woodman, said: “On May 28 at around 3.30pm, a Ms Dyson was driving along Pickmere Lane in Cheshire and she came behind a Ford vehicle that was veering across the lanes.“She overtook the Ford car and saw the driver, Laura Roberts, and thought that she looked drunk. As she moved in front of the Ford car, it went into the back of her car.“Ms Dyson got out and spoke to Roberts and called the police. The police came and did a breathalyser test and found her to have two readings - 150mg of alcohol in her breath and 130mg.“As they had two separate readings, they took a sample of blood and they got a reading of 266mg in 100ml of blood - which is well over three times the limit.“In an interview, she said she had been drinking. She had been at a festival with her children and the previous day she had been drinking toffee flavoured vodka.“She said she then woke up in the morning and had a glass of wine. She then left the festival at two in the afternoon.“After the accident, she said that she was beginning to feel the wine that she had earlier that day. Her children were in the car at the time.”Defending, Maria Brannon, said: “She is of good character, with no previous convictions, and has been driving for 19 years with no endorsements.“She has two daughters who are two and four years of age, and she is well regarded in her job working in administration at Wigan Council.“She was at the Geronimo Festival in Cheshire with her children and her and her friend had been camping there and they didn’t drive home until after lunch.“A combination of the alcohol from the night before and the sunburn made her feel ill when she was driving home.“Ms Roberts is aware that she is going to be disqualified from driving today.“Ms Roberts is very ashamed of what happened. Since her husband left her 20 months ago, she has been the sole, primary carer of her children and has been working very hard.“This incident was completely out of character for her and it is highly unlikely that she will commit an offence like this again.“This was a special treat for her children after the difficult 18 months they had since her husband left.She went with her two children and another family to the festival at Arley Hall.“She said that she felt tired just before she drove home but put it down to sunburn. So, she decided to drive - a decision that she bitterly regrets.“She took a wrong turn and got lost down a country lane and this was where the accident happened.“A woman had driven in front of her and Ms Roberts had not seen her until it was too late.She was very apologetic to the woman and the police and there was no damage caused to the car.“Ms Roberts bitterly regrets her decision to drive with the children in the back of her car. However, it must be said that there are no social services involved in the matter and it’s not in dispute that she has been an excellent mother in difficult circumstances.“She is distraught that she put her own children and future at risk.“But there are mitigating factors. First of all, the immediate guilty plea secondly her lack of previous convictions, and also her exemplary character. She is the sole primary career of her two young children.”Roberts was given a 12 months community order and will have to do 100 hours of unpaid work.She was also banned from driving for 2 years.

title: westminster car witnesses cyclists
story: Barry Williams told the Victoria Derbyshire show he saw cyclists knocked to the ground as a silver vehicle careered into barriers outside the Houses of Parliament.The BBC worker said: I saw a silver car heading towards cyclists on the wrong side of the road. They were parked waiting for the lights to change.“He hit them then swerved over towards the safety barrier. And then accelerated and hit it at quite high speed“It hit with quite a thud. The car actually came off the ground and landed again.“He hit about five cyclists. One actually got up and began to chase the car.This is what we know so far...“It was frightening. The police were very fast - they vaulted over the barrier followed by armed police.”The driver, in his 20s, was arrested on suspicion of terrorist offences and led away in handcuffs before cops confirmed the Mets Counter-Terrorism Command is now leading the investigation.Witnesses told of horror scenes as the car driving up to 50mph crashed outside Parliament just after 7.30am.Eyewitness Jason Williams said: Someone driving towards Parliament at speed, it wasnt a minor accident, it wasnt a road traffic incident.It was, in my opinion, something planned and something very sinister.Another witness Ewalina Ochab added: I think it looked intentional - the car drove at speed and towards the barriers.I was walking on the other side (of the road). I heard some noise and someone screamed.A chilling video showed cyclists sprawled injured in the street moments after the car smashed into barriers.One woman suffered serious, but non-life threatening, injuries while two other men also needed medical treatment.Met Police confirmed the suspect - who is not believed to have been armed - is currently being quizzed on suspicion of terror offences at a South London police station.But cops said he is not cooperating.Assistant Commissioner Neil Basu said in a police press conference that officers were now working to establish the motive behind the attack.He said: It appears to be a deliberate act. We are treating it as a terrorist incident.A COBRA meeting is due to take place at 2pm to discuss this mornings suspected terrorist incident.Dramatic footage after the crash shows heavily-armed police pointing rifles inside a silver car after it crashed into black barriers.A London Ambulance spokesman said two people were taken to hospital and one was treated at the scene - with none thought to have life-threatening injuries.Mr Williams later told ITVs Good Morning Britain that the incident was very, very scary.He said: I’ve seen a man driving a vehicle, and hes gone into one of the bollards. There was a loud bang.Straight away I thought Oh no, this is another terrorist attack. So I’ve just started to run and the police were saying get out, get out of the area.The incident comes just over a year after terrorist Khalid Masood drove into pedestrians and rammed the gates of Parliament in a terror attack.The jihadi killed five people including Westminster cop PC Keith Palmer before he was shot dead by armed police.Streets around Parliament Square, Millbank and Victoria Tower Gardens have been cordoned off with dozens of police, ambulances and firefighters at the scene.While Westminster Bridge has been closed to cars and pedestrians and nearby Lambeth Bridge is also to be shut imminently.

title: americas vj day celebrations victory japan colourised photos
story: Among the vivid colour images is one showing a delighted woman using paper as a makeshift megaphone to announce the victory to people on the street on VJ Day.Another image shows two women holding up newspapers, one from the day war started and the other declaring peace.Other photos show the joy felt by sailors and DC residents as they danced the conga in Washington.Stunning shots show US soldier holding Japanese flags in celebration, raising the American flag in Okinawa as well as the iconic photo of a sailor kissing a woman in Times Square, New York.Additional images from WW2 itself have been shown, including the 1941 Pearl Harbor attack by Japan on the US Fleet, and the Nagasaki nuclear bomb by the US against Japan in 1945 – the moment which led to the surrender by Japan and effectively brought World War 2 to a close.The original black and white photographs were painstakingly colourised by electrician Royston Leonard from Cardiff, Wales.The 53-year-old said: “As time goes by I find I am doing more World War Two pictures and giving them a bit of colour helps the younger generation to connect and not just see them as something that happened long ago.“The pictures show that community is all that matters, not buildings or material things.“Their message is that the more people try to destroy us, the more we will smile and carry on.”Victory over Japan Day is the day when Imperial Japan surrendered in World War Two, bringing the Second World War to an end.The term applies both to the day on which the initial announcement of Japan’s surrender was made – August 15th 1945 – and when the signing of the surrender document occurred – September 2nd 1945.VJ Day is commemorated on August 15th in the UK, while the US remember it on September 2nd.The name V-J Day was selected by the Allies after they named V-E Day for the victory in Europe.Mr Royston says that his passion for colourisation has helped him improve his photography skills.He said: “I have learnt so much from colourising, I feel it has helped my photography along the way.“The message is already there for all to see in the pictures themselves but I do feel that colourisation helps the younger generation to understand that what happened was real.“I love giving more life to the pictures and I think that colour improves the story that the photographs tell.”

title: staggering 330000 more brits are in work than a year ago as record numbers of east europeans go home
story: The Office for National Statistics revealed employment rose by 42,000 to 32.39 million in the three months to June.And over the past year, there has been a ‘net’ increase of 332,000 in UK nationals in work, and an 86,000 drop in the number of EU citizens – the largest fall since comparable records began in 1997.The fall was led by Poles heading back to the Continent.The number of Romanians and Bulgarians with a job in Britain leapt by 54,000 to 391,000 – equivalent to a city the size of Leicester.Work and Pensions Secretary Esther McVey said today’s figures showed a “vibrant jobs market benefitting people across the board”.The minister added: Record rates of ethnic minority people in work also show that more families across our society are benefiting from the security of a job, with wages also on the increase.We have some of the most creative, innovative and hard-working young people in the world and this summer Ive been urging them to take on a summer job, gaining soft skills - or as I call them, essential skills - for their future careers.Meanwhile the unemployment rate fell to the lowest levels for 43 years – 4 per cent – despite the doom and gloom about the slowing economy.But experts warned the jobs growth was showing signs of “petering out”. And business groups said the ‘Brexodus’ of EU nationals was “hampering firms’ ability to compete and create jobs”.CBI employment chief Matthew Percival said: “It’s vital that the UK pursues an open and controlled post-Brexit immigration policy.“The Government needs to guarantee that EU workers can continue to work even in a ‘No deal’ scenario.”The ONS also revealed job vacancies increased by 20,000 to a record high of 829,000, while average earnings increased by 2.4 per cent in the year to June, down from 2.5 per cent the previous month.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: mum found period stains new dress pretty little thing
story: Sacha Brown, 38, said she was livid when she discovered her £8 bargain from Pretty Little Thing was soiled with blood.She quickly washed her hands several times after taking delivery of the white lace bodycon dress on Monday — bought ahead of a holiday to St Lucia with her son next week.Nail technician Sasha, from Surbiton, South West London, told The Sun Online: Im going on holiday next Monday with my nine-year-old son to St Lucia in the Caribbean.I decided to order some new clothes from Pretty Little Things online to take on holiday with me.Among the items was a white lace bodycon dress reduced to £8.The dress arrived this afternoon and I opened it up to take a look at it and make sure it fits before packing it away.It clips together in the crotch area with some buttons, which I opened up so I could try it on.But when I looked at the lining I noticed three large blood stains — I was like, What the actual f***.I am livid. I could not believe what I was seeing.I am absolutely convinced it is blood stains from a period. As a woman, you know these things when you see them.Someone has obviously ordered the dress and tried it on without wearing underwear or a pad before sending it back.Who would do something like that? I just think its so disgusting.There should be common sense that if its an item like this that attaches at the crotch area should be thoroughly checked before offering it up for sale again.I washed my hands four times after.This is my first bad experience with Pretty Little Thing. The prices are reasonable — I just wanted a few cheap things to take on holiday with me.But now I would seriously reconsider shopping with them ever again.They have exposed me to someone elses blood — I expect compensation. I am very upset.I went on their website and tried to reach their customer service line to complain but I could not find their number anywhere.A spokesperson for Pretty Little Thing said: We’re really sorry to hear Sacha has received her item this way. Our customer service team have contacted Sacha and she has been issued a full refund on her order and we’ll be looking further into this.

title: newborn baby schoolgirl 15 found bin parents lancashire home
story: The teenager has revealed to police investigating the death of the babe that she did not know she was pregnant until she went in labour in the bathroom of her family home in Wesham, Lancashire.Lancashire Police are investigating the circumstances of the boys death last Thursday at the house in Garstang Road North.They are trying to find out whether a criminal offence or an offence under the Coroners Act has been committed.The teenager spent two days in hospital after the birth of the child.After that she was interviewed by police.She revealed that after she delivered the baby she placed the childs body in the bin.Her mother and father- he is a former serviceman- were out at the time.The teen was later found by a relative who rang emergency services.A post mortem has been carried out and police are awaiting the outcome of medical tests.

story: The cheesy series of photos sees swooning couples stare awkwardly into each others eyes, adopt ridiculous poses and even don gas masks to show off their newly-engaged love to the world.In one photo, a couple straddle a canon by the coast and in another, a couple pose armed with a bow and arrow and slingshot.Another bizarre photo shows a couple hiding behind a public bin while a separate couple hold hands with a stick figure sign for a public toilet.Two nature lovers are snapped in a well placed flurry of Autumnal leaves as two daredevils sprawl across a railway track in their engagement photo - and one couple appears to take the together forever vow seriously as they pose holding hands and sharing a scarf.Take a look at some of the worlds cringiest engagement photos below.

title: fortnite streamer ninja i dont play with female gamers
story: He justified his decision to only play with male gamers by saying: "If I have one conversation with one female streamer where we're playing with one another, and even if there's a hint of flirting, that is going to be taken and going to be put on every single video and be clickbait forever."Ninja married fellow Twitch gamer Jessica "JGhosty" Blevins last year, with the couple recently celebrating their one-year anniversary. She is also his manager.He said his decision was not due to any pressure from his wife, saying: "She had nothing to do with it. That was me being, 'I love our relationship,' and, 'No - I'm not even gonna put you through that'."Ninja concluded: "The only way to avoid [the rumours] is to not play with them at all," insisting female gamers wouldn't be upset and it was "a respect thing".He has since responded to the negative criticism his comments have received.Writing on Twitter, he said: "While I understand some people have implied my views mean I have something against playing with women, I want to make clear the issue I'm addressing is online harassment, and my attempt to minimize it from our life."Ninja said he felt the need to highlight the issue because he said it "affects all streamers, especially ones that make their relationships public" and that his "comments should not be characterized as anything beyond that."Female gamers on Twitch have previously highlighted harassment and trolling they have received - predominantly about their appearance - while on the platform.A derogatory term - "Twitch thot" - which has been used to describe female streamers on the site is defined by Urban Dictionary as "someone who streams on twitch, normally a female, who uses her body for personal gain".

title: 7 summer activities you can
story: Advertorial7 summer activities you can do with the kids without breaking the bankThe summer holiday can be costly, so here are some ideas of low-cost family activities to enjoy togetherShare&nbspByHolly Thatcher15:11, 6 AUG 2018Updated16:22, 13 AUG 2018AdvertorialGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe summer holidays are a great time to create wonderful memories with the family. The good news is that spending quality time with the ones you love doesn’t have to be expensive. Here are some suggestions for activities the family will love without costing the Earth… 1. Pimp an old bike A bike ride is a fantastic way to spend time with the kids, and it can be combined with a low-cost picnic for an even nicer day. Anyone with small people in their lives will vouch for the fact that they don’t stay small for long. The advantage? They quickly outgrow their bikes, meaning there’s likely to be plenty of friends and family with once-loved models gathering dust in the garage or shed.  If your child doesn’t have a bike, speak to friends, neighbours – or check out Freecycle . Once you’ve got your hands on some pre-loved wheels, take your bike to Halfords for a Free Bike Check . In-store experts will check tyre pressure, brakes and gears. If they spot anything that needs attention, they can fix it too. If you'd prefer to go new than second hand, Halfords currently has a range of kids' bikes at up to 30% off - like the BMX-style Apollo Ace Kids' Bike, &pound63 (save &pound27), which is suitable for ages three to 11 - depending on the model.  2. Get them growing   Kids love getting their hands dirty – and if you have a garden or access to an allotment then you can join forces to tackle the weeds and grow some wonderful flowers, fruit and vegetables. Reward the littl’un who pulls up the most weeds, hold a sunflower growing competition, or see who can coax the biggest marrow from the soil. You can encourage kids to help by letting them choose their own plants: fruits like strawberries and tomatoes are also fun and reasonably simple to grow – they also have a tasty reward at the end! 3. Make some real lemonade  Making real lemonade is simple to do, inexpensive and unbeatable on a warm day. Gather some lemons, sugar and water (you’ll need roughly 140g of caster sugar and 1 litre of water for every three lemons).  Once it's ready, enjoy in the shade of the Halfords 250 Fully Waterproof Gazebo, &pound39 (save &pound11) - perfect for covering a lemonade stand or an outdoor play area. 4. Go hunting for bats   Bats are glorious creatures, and the summer months are a good time to get out and spot them. As the sun sets you can usually spot these flying mammals darting about in the sky. Their erratic flight patterns mean they're easy to distinguish from birds, and keeping an eye out for them is a great way to spend an evening. You can also head to your local park with an evening picnic – use the Halfords Coolbag Trolley , &pound15 (half price), to get your food there with minimal carrying effort. As it gets dark, lie back on a Halfords XL Waterproof Picnic Blanket,&pound10 (half price), and spot the sonar-equipped mosquito-munchers in action.  Or, if you're looking to go further afield, why not take the Urban Escape 6 Person Vis A Vis Tent along and make it an overnight trip. It's currently half price at just &pound125. Take some facts about bats with you too, so the little ones will learn about one of nature's most misunderstood creatures. For example, bats can – apparently – consume up to 1,200 mosquitos per hour and will sometimes eat their own bodyweight in insects in a single night. You'll find loads of information and details about organised Bat Walks on the Bat Conservation Trust's website. 5. Get them stargazing Those summer nights are ideal for checking out the cosmos. The lack of clouds means uninterrupted views of the universe and the hot weather means you'll get a nice warm evening to gaze into space. You don't need special equipment for basic stargazing. Apps for your phone will tell you what's visible, and guide you to interesting stars and planets, as well as giving you the names of constellations. The Moon often looks stunning, and it's also possible to spot Jupiter and Saturn in the night sky using the naked eye. If you have a decent pair of binoculars you can also spot nebulae and get a great view of our solar system. The Moon, in particular, is a great thing to examine with binoculars.  An Urban Escape King Size Moon Chair , &pound30 (half price), is the perfect spot (with the perfect name) for checking out the cosmos. If you get the bug, check out your local stargazing club. Often you'd be expected to take your own telescope but many would be thrilled to let you experience the night sky through their equipment – check the internet and don't be afraid to fire off an email. 6. Watch a movie in the moonlight   Across the country there are multiple places to catch a movie in the great outdoors. Search hard enough and you might even find free outdoor movies near you. Taking in a movie on the big screen outdoors can be a great way to spend time with the family. Pack yourselves a nice supper in the Summerhouse Seville 4 Person Wicker Picnic Basket, &pound69.99 - and don’t forget to include the popcorn! 7. Take a low-cost road trip

title: foreign secretary jeremy hunt says
story: NewsForeign Secretary Jeremy Hunt says Jeremy Corbyn would have 'no moral authority' to condemn terrorist attacks as Prime MinisterHis comments have ratcheted up the pressure on the Labour leader in the ongoing anti-Semitism rowShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent13:54, 14 AUG 2018Updated14:03, 14 AUG 2018News (Image: PA)Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Foreign Secretary has said Jeremy Corbyn would have no moral authority to condemn terrorist attacks on British citizens if he ever became prime minister. Jeremy Hunt's deeply damaging comments have ratcheted up the pressure on the Labour leader in the ongoing anti-Semitism row. Mr Corbyn came under attack from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after it emerged that he attended a ceremony where a wreath was was laid in memory of Palestinians suspected of being behind the Munich Olympics massacre. The Labour leader has acknowledged he was present at the event at the Palestinian Martyrs Cemetery in Tunisia in 2014, but said he did not think he was involved in the wreath-laying.  Supporters insisted he had made clear his abhorrence for the I972 Munich attack, when 11 Israeli athletes were killed, and that he condemned all terrorist acts.  Writing on Twitter , Mr Hunt said: If Jeremy Corbyn thinks terrorism is justified for the causes he believes in, how would he as prime minister have the moral authority to condemn terrorist murders of British citizens? Unbelievable and shocking.   Benjamin Netanyahu slams Jeremy Corbyn over claims he laid wreath at terrorists' graves  The president of the Board of Deputies of British Jews, Marie van der Zyl, poured scorn on Mr Corbyn's claim his that he was not involved in the wreath-laying.  She said he needed to understand he could not cavort with terrorists. After days of being evasive, Jeremy Corbyn has now admitted attending a memorial event for the terrorist murders of unarmed athletes. How can you say he is not involved? she told BBC Radio 4's Today programme. In 1972, these are unarmed people who were attending the Olympics, they were savagely mutilated and murdered. There is no reason Jeremy Corbyn should not apologise to the widows and to the victims for this terrible massacre. He needs to also recognise that he can't cavort with terrorists. The row originally erupted after the Daily Mail published pictures of Mr Corbyn holding a wreath in the cemetery, which it said were taken in front of a plaque honouring the founder of the Black September terror group.  Labour said he had attended the event to remember victims of a 1985 Israeli air strike on Palestinian Liberation Organisation (PLO) offices in Tunis. However, in a highly unusual intervention, he was accused by Mr Netanyahu of laying a wreath at the grave of one of the terrorists responsible for the Munich attack.  The laying of a wreath by Jeremy Corbyn on the graves of the terrorist who perpetrated the Munich massacre and his comparison of Israel to the Nazis deserves unequivocal condemnation from everyone - left, right and everything in between, he wrote on Twitter.  However, Mr Corbyn hit back, saying the Israeli leader's claims were false.

title: mad boris tea party tells
story: NewsopinionThe Mad Boris tea party tells us all we need to know about this shabby charlatanGiving tea to journalists is an old trick - and Boris did it badlyShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist13:26, 13 AUG 2018Updated14:07, 13 AUG 2018NewsopinionGet politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email When grizzled old hacks gather to share stories of scandals past, it is not unknown for them to speak fondly of Mary Archer.  The fragrant wife of convicted perjurer and former Tory deputy chairman Sir Jeffrey is still beloved, three decades later, for bringing a cup of tea to the press pack gathered outside their Cambridgeshire vicarage during one of her husband's many scandals. That someone hounded and pursued by the forces of Fleet Street should be so hospitable was considered remarkable, even heroic. It bought her considerable goodwill, not just because a small village in Cambridgeshire is bereft of places to buy tea but also because, when on a job miles from anywhere, bored and stood outside in all weathers, it is a civilising pleasure to drink from china rather than Styrofoam. It humanises those on all sides - if hunter and hunted both drink tea, they think the other can't be all bad. It is a moment of peace and acknowledgement of the other's tribulations, like Christmas Day football between enemies in World War One. It doesn't end the war, but it's a nice thought.  In 2007, footballer Teddy Sheringham performed the same feat when his then-girlfriend Danielle Lloyd was in the Celebrity Big Brother house and embroiled in a race row with Jade Goody and Shilpa Shetty.  Only he did it half-naked.   And so it was that this weekend former Foreign Secretary and habitual-utterer-of-nasty-things Boris Johnson 'did a Mary', as it is known by some, and produced a tray of tea for the photographers gathered outside his country home in Oxfordshire.  There is a lot that can be gleaned from a person's tea habits, and even more from a tray produced for others. While gazing enviously at Teddy's abdomen, you will I am sure have noticed he carried a set of matching mugs, minimalist aluminium sugar caddy, and a 2-pint bottle of semi-skimmed milk, on a pleasingly biscuit-coloured wooden tray. All very stripped-down and simple. You get the impression this is a man who does not like mess, and treats strangers with the same high standards he expects in his own life. Two pints tells you he lives alone, and frugally. The tray says his kitchen is pristine, and his fingernails clean.  I'm not sure what Mary's tea tray looked like - but there are rumours it involved proper cups with saucers. AND BISCUITS.  Boris did not do that. In fact, Boris could not have made more of a cock-up of it if he tried.  The tray contains a hotch-potch of thick clay mugs. One came free with an Easter egg. One looks like it usually has toothbrushes in it. Another bears a corporate logo, and one appears to be from a Battersea Power Station sponsorship programme.  They are, in short, the mugs you make the staff drink from. Mugs that don't matter.  And no sugar bowl for the snappers. No. A half-open packet of granulated, no doubt with a used spoon wedged in it.  This is a tray that screams YOU'RE ALL PEASANTS, NOW SAY THANK YOU.   And bear in mind, this is the fellow's second home. He's a multi-millionaire. There's bound to be nice mugs and a milk jug in that farmhouse somewhere, he just hasn't bothered to produce them. The milk is truly boggling. The man has four children and a wife. The children are grown up, but even if they weren't at home there's a minimum of two adults there for the whole weekend, and possibly friends and political advisers visiting. A single pint of milk wouldn't last an afternoon, so anyone sane would buy a 4-pinter on the trip down from London. Which leads me to the uncomfortable conclusion that Boris is either so stupid he bought several, more expensive 1-pint bottles, or that he keeps an old 1-pinter to use as a milk jug. And that's just skanky.  He is the antithesis of Teddy Sheringham. This is a tea boy who leaves you wondering whether the mugs were washed first, and what in. His fingernails, were they to be inspected, would almost certainly contain traces of the past week's bogeys. Boris did admirably in refusing to answer questions, and declaring himself on a humanitarian mission because you have been here all day and you've been incredibly patient. But if the purpose of his jaunt down the garden path was to buy goodwill, it failed for three simple reasons.  The first is that tea is fundamentally about good manners. The same rituals and purpose apply whether in a Japanese tea ceremony or a truckers' roadside caff. Boris' tray displays an impolite lack of consideration, and would be looked at aghast were he to offer such a thing at an official reception, to his in-laws, or to Theresa May.  But seeing as Boris is in his current disciplinary hate-crime pickle because he likened veiled Muslim women to letterboxes, manners are presumably something he lacks on a grand scale.  The second is that, if this tray is really the best he could muster, he must surely have seen that it needed adornment of some kind. Half a packet of Digestives, perhaps, or a handful of Penguins. Anything. Instead, it's as graceless as his writing. And third is the basic rule that anyone volunteering for a tea run is usually doing it to be nice - to repay an earlier run done by a colleague, to suck up to someone, or to apologise for past wrongs.  In Boris' case, he's doing it to pretend to be nice. A bit like when he and Gideon Osborne sat down with some Transport for London workers in hi-vis jackets, and tried for a photo that didn't make them look like Buller boys talking to daddy's horse valet.   In short, the best that Boris could do, when caught in a jam of his own making and confronted by journalists, was to attempt deflection with a half-hearted tea round that did little more than belittle the people he delivered it to. The proof is in the pudding with these things, and those journalists will no sooner give him an easier ride tomorrow than he will deliver them a tea pot and the family china.  Not just because since Boris' column last week there has been an increase in reported hate incidents against women wearing a face veil, but because journalists know and loathe Boris of old.  He's been fired for making up quotes from his own godfather, promised to use journalistic means to track down the address of someone a mate wanted beaten up, and has not only used his pen to foment racism but boasted of the &pound250,000 he is reportedly paid for doing it.

title: breastfeeding mum left tears after
story: NewsBreastfeeding mum left in tears after being told she was 'putting diners off their teacakes' in cafeNikki Davis, 32, had her confidence shattered after a fellow customer told her to feed her baby in the toiletShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByHana Carter14:13, 14 AUG 2018Updated14:56, 14 AUG 2018NewsNikki is a new mum to Dulcie and said the incident affected her confidence (Image: SWNS- Cambridge)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A mother was left in tears after she was told that she was putting another customer off their teacake because she was breastfeeding in a cafe.  Nikki Davis, 32, a new mum from Essex, was told that she should feed her six-week-old baby in a toilet because it was offensive to breastfeed in public. It wasn't just Nikki who was singled out, the friends she was with were labelled as the 'mammary brigade' by the unhappy woman. She said: I met two frineds from my National Childbirth Trust class. We've all recently had babies so wanted to meet up to support each other at the cafe. It was really distressing to hear and actually made me cry.  Her friends were also breastfeeding, which seemed to aggravate the complainant further, Nikki said: I overheard the woman describe us to her family as the 'mammary brigade' and stated we were putting her off her teacake. Refusing to take anymore jibes, Nikki decided to confront the customer and explain how the comments had upset her. Nikki, who is mum to Dulcie, said: The woman responded stating she found it offensive and we should feed our babies in the toilet. This whole incident has really knocked my confidence as a new mum.

title: british woman 81 claims benidorm
story: NewsBritish tourist moans her Benidorm holiday was ruined by 'too many Spanish people'Freda Jackson, 81, said she cried at the end of her two-week trip to the popular holiday destination through travel operator Thomas Cook in May this yearShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByTom Kershaw10:41, 13 AUG 2018Updated17:04, 13 AUG 2018NewsFreda Jackson, 81, said that Spanish people should go somewhere else for their holidays (Image: Lancashire  / SWNS)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA British woman has claimed her holiday to Benidorm was ruined because her hotel had 'too many Spaniards in it' Freda Jackson, 81, said that Spanish people should go somewhere else for their holidays and she cried at the end of her two-week trip. The pensioner, who suffers from mobility issues, says her accommodation was teeming with 'rude' native Spaniards - who nearly knocked her over on one occasion. Retired care assistant Freda said: The hotel was full of Spanish holidaymakers and they really got on our nerves because they were just so rude. One evening a Spanish guy nearly knocked me flying and he just walked off without even apologising. The entertainment in the hotel was all focused and catered for the Spanish - why can't the Spanish go somewhere else for their holidays?  Freda had booked to stay at the Poseidon Playa, located on the outskirts of Benidorm in south east Spain, with a friend in April 2017. The pensioner says the travel operator Thomas Cook had even recommended the hotel and despite her request for flat ground access, it was located on a slope instead. Grandmother-of-six Freda and her 61-year-old friend paid a total of &pound1,133 for the holiday and have demanded a full refund or a free trip. Freda, who lives in Blackburn, Lancashire, said: I have never complained about a holiday before - but this one was a disaster from start to finish.  My friend and I paid for it from our pensions and it was a struggle trying to fund it over 12 months and the holiday was totally ruined - I cried after. We wanted to go somewhere on flat ground and not in the hills because we have mobility issues. To top it off once we got to reception they told us we had been put on the 14th floor, thankfully we were moved to the second floor, and that it was 42 steps down to the hotel's swimming pool. The pair travelled 1,500 miles from Manchester Airport to Alicante on May 10, after not being notified by Thomas Cook that the dates of their flights had changed. Freda, who has previously visited Greece, Turkey, Portugal and Tenerife, claims Thomas Cook 'mis-sold' and 'ruined' her dream holiday.  She said there were no reps on the holiday who they could complain to about the trip - so instead Ms Jackson submitted a letter of complaint to Thomas Cook. Thomas Cook bosses initially offered Freda and her friend a &pound75 holiday voucher as compensation for the 'disappointing' trip abroad. But after declining the initial 'goodwill gesture' made by the travel company, they made an improved offer of &pound566 to be split between Freda and her friend. title: fitness entrepreneur uses baby shed
story: NewsFitness entrepreneur uses his BABY to shed the four stone he piled on when his son was bornSion Monty, 30, was determined to ditch his 'dad bod' with the help of his newborn babyShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByHana Carter09:56, 14 AUG 2018Updated12:11, 14 AUG 2018NewsSion put on four stone in six months (Image: Sion Monty / SWNS)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA new dad and fitness entrepreneur dropped the four stone he gained when his son was born by exercising with his newborn. Sion Monty, 30, who owns a gym, was mortified to discover he had hit 16 stone in just six months.  But with his business reputation on the line and wanting to ensure he was a healthy parent to his son Tedi, he ditched the weight with the help of his new tot.  Sion, who also has his own gym clothing line and supplement range vowed to lose weight after he hit 16 stone by doing daily runs, hill sprints and long walks with Tedi in his pram.    But thanks to a diet overhaul and exercising six days-a-week, he lost nearly four stone, buffed up and got super fit for his little lad and proud partner Kara Williams, 27.   Now body-confident Sion - who used to refuse to take off his jumper in the gym - is competing in competitions and inspiring other 'dad bods' on social media.  Sion, from Porthmadog, Wales, said: I didn't want to be a fat dad. I looked in the mirror and realised that if I wanted to live a long life and see my son live his life I needed to change.  I was so body conscious and maybe a bit embarrassed because I was known as a fit guy.  I knew I had to involve Tedi in getting fit if I was going to fit it in, while spending time with him.  You should have seen how much he laughed at his dad jogging up the hills.  He loves birds, so I would choose walks and runs where he there were lots of birds for us to spot together.  My exercise had dropped off because I just didn't have time to spent that time away from the family. But the key was involving them in it.  Sion first piled on the pounds during his first year at university, going from 12st 7lb to 15st 7lb in 2011.  He said the wake up call was being called fat by friends at home and he lost all the weight in one summer.  His partner Kara, an administrator, had their son in July 2017, and being a dad zapped his energy, and he started have takeaways up to five times a week.  Before my son arrived it was my girlfriend, work and the gym - that was it, he said.  I ate quite well and enjoyed the odd takeaway at the weekend. I totally underestimated how much having a child actually takes over your life.  My family came first, then my businesses and soon going to the gym and fitness went out the back door.  My baby suffered with reflux, he never slept, we were always tired, we didn't have any time for cooking, and it was really hard work.

title: food blogger takes latest food
story: NewsFood blogger Katie Ovens takes on 8,000-calorie doner kebab the size of a PILLOW in epic food challengeSocial media star Katie Ovens, 24, demolished the 3kg 'sandwich' which contains an estimated 8,000 caloriesShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByLaura Forsyth15:01, 14 AUG 2018Updated15:24, 14 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A food blogger was almost a goner when she took on her latest food challenge - a doner kebab the size of a pillow.  Social media star Kate Ovens, famed for her massive appetite, ploughed her way through a giant lamb and chicken kebab - a dish dubbed 'London's biggest kebab.' The 24-year-old demolished the 3kg 'sandwich,' despite it containing an estimated 8,000 calories. The massive kebab was eight times bigger than normal and contained four times the recommended daily intake for a woman.  Courageous chewer Kate, who runs the successful Kate's Food Challenges Facebook page, took just under an hour to munch her way through the massive lamb and chicken doner kebab - because she needed to keep taking breaks.   The 5ft 5ins foodie said: I reckon I was eating for about 45 minutes, but I did need to keep taking breaks before the end. It's unusual to have such nice bread with a kebab and it was really doughy and fluffy. At first it was incredible - I loved getting served a kebab the size of a pillow. But towards the end, I would have preferred my bed - it was very tiring. Kate, from Kennington, south London, was invited to try the massive kebab - which stood more than 6 inches tall and measured more than 18 inches long - at the new Fulham branch of German Doner Kebab, in south west London. She said: The kebab was absolutely lovely, but the bread blanket was almost the end of me. It was thick and doughy, and there was so much of it.  But the only reason I reckon I could finish it is because it was of such great, premium quality. Every bite was fantastic - it's just that there were a lot of bites. Kate's hefty kebab contained lamb and chicken as well as her five-a-day portions of salad and tomatoes and lashings of garlic mayo. What makes her mammoth eating feat even more remarkable is that it was her first challenge in more than two months - and she didn't do any training. To give her the best chance of success, die-hard Cottager Kate wore her lucky 2010 Fulham FC shirt - which she wore when her beloved team won the playoffs at Wembley last season. She added: I asked them not to put chilli sauce in it, because I'm a wimp.

title: queen hiring someone work kitchen
story: NewsThe Queen is hiring someone to work in her kitchen - and you get to live at Buckingham PalaceThe royal family is looking for a new kitchen porter at Buckingham Palace, and the package comes with on-site accommodation AND all your mealsShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByZoe ForseyActing Audience Editor12:05, 14 AUG 2018Updated12:56, 14 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWhen we're looking for a new job, we have to consider the full package and perks as well as the role itself. It's important to consider the salary, career progression, pension and other benefits before accepting a new role. But the Queen has gone all out when it comes to staff perks, and is making an offer most would find hard to refuse. She's looking for a new kitchen porter, and the successful applicant will get to live on-site at Buckingham Palace. And what makes it even better is you don't need any experience, so it really is open to everyone.  The new role, which is advertised on the Royal Family website, is a permanent position in the palace's catering team paying &pound19,935.80-a-year. The successful applicant will be expected to work full time, five days over seven days a week between Monday and Sunday. They'll get 33 days holiday, a 15 per cent employer contribution pension scheme, training and a range of other employee benefits. But undoubtedly the best bit is the on-site accommodation, which also includes all meals. The advert states: It's working as a team to achieve exceptional results. It's having a shared and unique purpose, joining a professional team who deliver extraordinary service. This is what makes working for the Royal Household so different.  You'll join a committed Kitchen team who work together to prepare and serve food to the very highest standards. By maintaining the kitchen and clear-up areas you'll ensure our chefs and assistants have all they need to deliver meals throughout the day. You'll also on occasion assist with food preparation. And whether you’re based in Buckingham Palace or travelling to other locations, you'll ensure all kitchens are presented to the same exceptional standard. Even though experience isn't required as all training will be provided, there are a few criteria.

story: NewsShocking moment OAP drives car onto train tracks to bring city's metro services to standstillEmergency services were called to the train line as the elderly lady was safely removed from the carShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByLaura Forsyth09:29, 14 AUG 2018Updated09:54, 14 AUG 2018NewsTrains were suspended between Newcastle Airport and Regent Centre (Image: ncjMedia Ltd)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email trains were brought to a halt after an elderly woman drove her car onto the tracks . Trains were suspended between Newcastle Airport and Regent Centre after the car was spotted on the line at Kingston Park. The driver had gone onto the railway at the level crossing and was heading towards Bank Foot Station before she stopped at the platform. Emergency services were called to the scene at around 8.30pm on Monday and safely got the woman out of the car. A Nexus spokesperson said that police and  engineers were assessing the situation before moving the car and letting trains run again, chroniclelive reported.   The level crossing and the track were also being checked for any damage. While trains were suspended, a taxi service was provided for passengers.  trains were back in service at around 9.15pm.

title: westminster incident dramatic moment heavily
story: NewsWestminster incident: Dramatic moment heavily-armed police pull driver from car after crashing into Parliament barriersA man has been arrested after the car 'hit pedestrians' and smashed into security barriers outside parliament this morningShare&nbspByElaine McCahill09:01, 14 AUG 2018Updated09:14, 14 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailDramatic footage shows the moment armed police pulled a driver out of a car after it smashed into security barriers outside parliament and injured pedestrians. Officers swooped on the scene and pulled the male driver out of the car at gunpoint. Footage shows police surrounding the vehicle with one officer aiming his firearm inside the driver's window.  Police surround the man as officers run to and fro in the chaotic scene.  The Met Police confirmed a number of pedestrians had been injured in the incident which has put the Palace of Westminster and the surrounding area on lockdown. Did you see what happened? Email webnews@trinitymirror    Eyewitnesses have told of how police rushed to the scene after the car smashed into the barriers which protect parliament.  Police cars raced to the scene as officers shut down the road and surrounded the car, which had smoke coming from under the crumpled bonnet. The driver was led away in handcuffs. Officers sealed off the area and later extended the cordon to keep people away from the scene, at one point telling people to move back. Eyewitness Jason Williams said he saw a car travelling at speed when it smashed into the bollard. He told ITV’s Good Morning Britain that the incident was very, very scary, adding that he was feeling very anxious.  He said: Basically I’ve seen a man driving a vehicle, and he’s gone into one of the bollards. There was a loud bang.‘Straight away I thought 'Oh no, this is another terrorist attack. So I’ve just started to run and the police were saying “get out, get out of the area'. It (the car) was behind me. I didn’t see anyone else involved. I just saw this one vehicle, so it seems to be deliberate. I was very surprised (the police didn’t go in straight away). They seemed to be standing back. They were obviously a bit wary, like what’s going to happen next? I don’t know if it was a tip-off, a warning, that this was a bomb. There seems to be maybe about 200 police here now, and it’s all happened very quickly in the space of half an hour.

title: westminster incident terrified eyewitnesses ran
story: NewsWestminster incident: Terrified eyewitnesses 'ran for their lives' and describe screams as 'speeding' car 'hit pedestrians'Those nearby said they feared for their lives after a man 'drove at 4mph' into the barriers at Westminster during morning rush hourShare&nbspByElaine McCahill10:07, 14 AUG 2018Updated10:29, 14 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailEyewitnesses have described the terrifying scene that unfolded at Westminster this morning when a man drove his car at speed into security barriers outside parliament. The Met Police confirmed a number of pedestrians have been injured in the incident which occurred during rush hour this morning. Armed police swooped on the scene and dramatic footage shows officers pull the driver out of the silver Ford at gunpoint. Those who were nearby have told of how they had to run as the scene unfolded in central London at around 7.30am. Read below for eyewitness accounts from the scene.  Did you see what happened? Email webnews@trinitymirror   'It looked intentional - the car drove at speed' Ewalina Ochab was on the other side of the road when the incident occurred and said: “I think it looked intentional - the car drove at speed and towards the barriers.” She said: “I was walking on the other side [of the road]. I heard some noise and someone screamed. I turned around and I saw a silver car driving very fast close to the railings, maybe even on the pavement. “The person driving did not go out” of the vehicle, she said. Ewalina also said the vehicle did not appear to have a front registration plate when it crashed.  'I was told to run...I have run for my life' Eyewitness Jason Williams said the car appeared to be travelling faster than 40mph when it was driven into a bollard. The businessman told the BBC: He had driven it at speed - more than 40mph. There was smoke coming out of the car. I have seen people on the ground, lying on the road. I don't know if they have actually been hit by the vehicle or not. I saw at least 10 people lying down. I was told basically to move away, to run. I have run for my life. He also told ITV’s Good Morning Britain that the incident was very, very scary, adding that he was feeling very anxious.  He said: Basically I’ve seen a man driving a vehicle, and he’s gone into one of the bollards. There was a loud bang. Straight away I thought 'Oh no, this is another terrorist attack. So I’ve just started to run and the police were saying “get out, get out of the area'. It (the car) was behind me. I didn’t see anyone else involved. I just saw this one vehicle, so it seems to be deliberate. I was very surprised (the police didn’t go in straight away). They seemed to be standing back. They were obviously a bit wary, like what’s going to happen next? I don’t know if it was a tip-off, a warning, that this was a bomb. There seems to be maybe about 200 police here now, and it’s all happened very quickly in the space of half an hour. Do you know who the driver is? Email webnews@trinitymirror  'All I saw was smoke...I stopped the bus' Bus driver Victor Ogbomo, 49, was driving passengers past the front of Westminster when he saw the crash. He said: All I saw was the smoke coming out of a vehicle, a silver vehicle ... I just stopped the bus. The police said we have to move back, then in less than five minutes the response team came. They went to the vehicle, so we had to push back. I saw the car in the barrier, I didn't know how it got there. I think someone was inside the vehicle because many police went towards the vehicle. He said officers had their guns out when they arrested the driver.

title: woman left toddler home alone
story: NewsWoman left toddler home alone at night after drinking THREE bottles of champagneAleksandra Pavare, 33, knocked back the booze then drove to her estranged husband's house in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffs leaving the young child home aloneShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByLaura Forsyth11:20, 14 AUG 2018NewsDrunk Aleksandra Pavare has appeared in court after she left a toddler at home alone during the night (Image: Stoke Sentinel/BPM MEDIA)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A woman left a toddler home alone during the night after drinking three bottles of champagne.   Aleksandra Pavare, 33, had downed the booze before driving to her estranged husband's house in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffs at around 10.30pm, leaving the young child alone.  Magistrates at North Staffordshire Justice Centre heard when she returned later that evening the child was awake in the living room and had been rummaging through food in the kitchen. Pavare, who comes from Latvia, was arrested. When she was interviewed by police she answered no comment to their questions. But she later went on to plead guilty to neglecting or abandoning a child. The court heard she had no previous convictions. Pavare told a probation officer that she had a history of depression and her 10-year marriage had recently broken down, leading to her use of alcohol as a 'coping mechanism'.

title: student 24 wants baby grandpa
story: NewsStudent, 24, wants baby with her 'grandpa' boyfriend, 60, despite 36 YEAR age gapSamantha Crosby, 24, said that she wants a baby to have a piece of her much older boyfriend Maxie Mills 'once he is gone'Share&nbsp&nbspCommentsByHana Carter11:56, 14 AUG 2018Updated12:06, 14 AUG 2018NewsSamantha, 24 and Maxie, 60 met at a concert and Samantha said it was 'love at first sight' (Image: Samantha Crosby / MDWfeatures)Get daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThey say age is just a number, and for one couple with a thirty-six year age gap that couldn't be more true as they plan to have children. Samantha Crosby, 24 and Maxie Mills, 60, from Washington, US, have said that they want to have a baby so that Maxie can live on after he 'dies of old age'. Despite often being confused as Samantha's grandfather and having a child nearly twice her age, Maxie is prepared to be the father of her child. The couple got together after meeting at a concert where Maxie was performing.  Samantha wasn't put off by Maxie's age and tracked him down on Facebook .  Initially, Maxie wasn't interested in Samantha, but bowled over by his musical talent, Samantha wouldn't let him go after she felt it was 'love at first sight'.  Samantha, who is a cosmetology student, has said she wants her own baby with Maxie for 'sentimental reasons', saying: I would like to one day have children, I have known for a long time that I want children, but now being with someone much older than me it is sort of more of a sentimental reason, I would like to have children with Maxie because after he passes away I would still have a piece of him. When out and about together, people often mistake Samantha for Maxie's daughter and when the couple explain they are romantically linked, they receive odd looks but say that their connection goes beyond age. Maxie has two children, a 40-year-old daughter and 35-year-old son from his previous marriages who don't yet know about their relationship. Samantha said: I started spending a lot of time with my mother. She enjoys going to wineries around town and listening to live music. One night I went with her to watch a friend of hers who plays in a group at a local winery, from there I quickly made friends with all the gentlemen in the band they are all in their fifties and sixties.   One of the band members had shoulder surgery, so he couldn't play guitar. Maxie filled in for him one night at a bar, my friend Kevin had told me that I would like Maxie, that he was a good guy and like him but with a southern accent. After I heard Maxie play my favourite Fleetwood Mac song, I instantly knew I wanted to get to know him. I tried making small talk with him at the bar after he finished playing, but he wasn't that interested. Later I added him on Facebook, initiated contact, and he was taken aback by it. We slowly started going out on dates. For me yes it was love at first sight, there was something more about him other than his Texan accent that I liked and wanted to get to know. For him I know it was different, he had a hard time coming to terms with my age and our relationship, he has stated to me before that it was my kindness to him that made him choose to give me a chance. I was attracted to him initially from his confidence and looks, once I got to know him, he was a better person than anyone else I had ever met. He was and has continuously been charming, kind, romantic and caring.  Our age gap is 36 years. It hasn't really caused much of a problem for us right now. I just moved in with Maxie a few weeks ago. I know that in the beginning his friends were hesitant about our relationship, suggesting that I was a gold digger. But since he is a school teacher, not the highest paid occupation, it became apparent that money was not what I was after. Other than that we both have a hard time dealing with outside people. By that I mean when we go out in public and we refer to each other as boyfriend and girlfriend and they give us odd looks, or for example we were out at a restaurant for dinner and the chef asked if I was his daughter, and Maxie simply replied back that no his daughter was much older than me. I have hard time with the fact that in my eyes he is my boyfriend, my partner and lover, and that everyone else sees our relationship as weird or odd. I have always dated people older than myself so it has never been out of character for me.    Samantha's family are very supportive of her relationship with Maxie, despite her mum being initially unsure, but after seeing how happy he makes her daughter is fully accepting of the couple.  I have had several people say that me dating him is gross. At the beginning my mother said that she thought me dating someone 36 years older than me was weird and I told her that that was fine she didn't have to think it was normal. Beyond that the usual is people assuming that I am his daughter. As I said he is a musician and he plays all over town so I get a lot of people that make comments when I go to see him. Some people apologise and other simply say 'oh'. I will say among his friends there are people who have taken to me easier than others.

title: plane passenger left just bra
story: NewsPlane passenger left in just her bra as she's tied up after 'going berserk' on flightThe plane crew tied her legs together and her hands behind her back, before sitting her on the floor of the planeShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByLaura Forsyth10:54, 14 AUG 2018Updated11:11, 14 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A partially dressed female air passenger screamed while her arms and legs were tied up, after she had to be restrained by cabin crew mid flight.  The blonde woman, topless but for her black bra, was held after she started causing havoc on a flight from the Russian capital city of Moscow, to the resort city of Antalya in south-western Turkey.  Cabin crew said the woman was out of control after drinking too much in the duty free bar at Moscow before boarding the flight, and they had to restrain her shortly after take off.  The woman was violent and abusive and her behaviour was frightening other passengers, they said. They tied her legs together and her hands behind her back, before sitting her on the floor of the plane away from other passengers.  It is not reported why she was only partially dressed. Footage shot by an eyewitness shows her trying to hit her head on the wall of the plane as a flight attendant tries to position a jacket to prevent her from hurting herself. The woman can be heard shouting: I am begging you. My arms are tied. I cannot get hold of you, please. You see what is going on. Look at me. Look at my blood. Those are beasts, those are liars, they are trying to trick you.

title: can you see it residents
story: NewsCan you see it? Residents baffled after chilling CCTV shows 'ghost' walking through traffic in PhilippinesThe apparition was caught on camera at a roadside in Pangasinan, Philippines, on June 20Share&nbsp&nbspCommentsByMirror.Co.Uk06:53, 14 AUG 2018Updated09:09, 14 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailChilling CCTV shows the moment a GHOST appears to walk through oncoming traffic before appearing in front of a grocery store. The male apparition was picked up on security cameras outside a shop in Pangasinan, Philippines, at 2pm on June 20. Surveillance footage from the same store shows a similar figure emerge 13 hours later as it lurks ominously next to a delivery man. The spooky sightings have baffled staff at the shop and even security guards have been alarmed by it.  Michael Forto said: ''I couldn't believe my eyes. I thought these things only happen on television. It seems that the shadow is looking at the delivery guy.'' The grocery mini mart is located in front of the town plaza and locals believe the apparition is the spirit of somebody with a grudge.

title: satanist teenager burns down historic
story: News'Satanist' teenager burns down historic 250-year-old wooden church built by Catherine the GreatSchoolboy Ignat Sharapov, 15, has been arrested as experts say it will cost more than £1million to repairShare&nbsp&nbspCommentsByWill Stewart12:31, 14 AUG 2018Updated12:34, 14 AUG 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay nowGet daily updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA teenage “Satanist” has been detained after he allegedly confessed to destroying one of Russia’s most historic churches in an arson attack. The wooden Dormition orthodox church on the shore of Lake Onega was erected in 1774 by Catherine the Great - and burned down in a raging inferno last week. Schoolboy Ignat Sharapov, 15 - whose social media is full of Satanist signs and images - has told police he set fire to the structure by using five litres of petrol to ignite its dry timber. An expert said it will cost &pound1 million to reconstruct the 138 ft church - as tall as a 12 storey building - at Kondopoga in Karelia republic in northern Russia. A law enforcement source said: “He classifies himself as a Satanist. Allegedly he just did not like the church.”  A witness said: He was a Satanist, dressed in black. And when he was detained by police, he laughed.” Over breakfast the teenager had told his relatives he was going to destroy the church which had stood beside Lake Onega for 244 years, but they thought he was joking. He asked his grandmother to wrap up some homemade biscuits for him to give to his friend, who he later met and read something on his tablet computer. “His expression changed - he got up and said: ‘I’m going to burn down the church',” his friend said. He doused the church in petrol then set fire to it. The church caretaker said: “He took with him five litres of gasoline, and walked along the lake.  The dry timber caught like a candle.” More than 20 firefighters with six appliances rushed to the scene of the famous church but were unable to extinguish the flames which destroyed the bell tower in a few minutes and the entire structure in two hours. The boy then fled the scene and was apprehended after his grandmother called the emergency services to report the fire. He has been held by police in detention pending further investigations into a criminal case involving arson. Sharapov’s social media contained a picture of a burning church before the attack on the historic 18th century building, along with many satanic images. State-run TV named the boy citing law enforcement sources and showed his satanic ‘temple’ in a disused poultry farm building daubed in devil-worshipping signs and slogans.
